channel.title: Packaging Question - Quick answer please
channel.description:
So I've been thinking what would be better for going in-depth in skills. As most of you know on a basic PI base the only real crafting is mostly jewelry and tanning etc, well I plan to one by one perfect most of the basic skills based on the 2007 database.
So here's my question: would it be better to jam most of the crafting elements in to the basic "Crafting.java" or do something more along the lines of; Package "Skills" > "Skill" > "Element".
And this question does apply to all skills, but I am mainly focusing on crafting just because I plan to do it first. So here's what I mean in example form. Either jam it all into one class file, or, Skills Folder > Crafting > Pottery. Skills Folder > Crafting > Tanning. And you get the point. I also apologize if this is repetitive, and if it sounds a bit crazy grammar-wise etc. It's 6:38am and I've yet to sleep.

item.title: Packaging Question - Quick answer please
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“Fire capez, post:6, topic:525968”]am i the only one who REALLY dislikes the idea of having separate packages for something so trivial as crafting? the class itself probably isn’t going to exceed 10kb[/quote]depends if remake or what. when I ran Myth-Scape I had like four different items in my crafting :o(staffs, tanning, gems, and something else can’t remember atm)

Read full topic

item.title: Packaging Question - Quick answer please
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

I like having an organized package as well. While it won’t make a huge difference it does make it look better personally.

I would go

skills

crafting

tools.java
specialty

gemcrafting
staffcrafting
etccrafting
data
gemdata
staffdata
etcdata

Read full topic
